text:
Hi everyone, I use <http://Make.com|Make.com> “search for tickets” module to get ticket information, specifically searching for tickets based on a property. I constantly get 429 error code from HubSpot api endpoint on my 9th API request. Here is the error that I receive:
`The operation failed with an error. [429] You have reached your request rate limit of 100 requests every 10 seconds. Please consider using a "Sleep" module together with the "Resume" error handler to retry after 10 seconds. HubSpot Correlation ID: 22d2fe11-0f39-4bac-9be3-9c0e3fba04d9`

Can anybody help me to explain why I reach the request limit with 9th request when the limit is 100 per 10 seconds?
If this is using a PrivateApp token, verify if there were other requests around that time using the same token by checking the logs for your private app.
Thanks for the tip, however there is no other private app using the token at the same moment.

Hello :slightly_smiling_face: Hope you are all doing well :slightly_smiling_face:
Any idea if we update a property type via API if it breaks any existing stuff  (workflow, views, ids of these properties) ?
I would like to update a property from single select to multiple checkbox but this is scary :scream:
when i use make, i tend to use the delay tool in there it should help
Thanks a lot, I also put a 10 second sleep as suggested and then resumed to scenario. However, I still don’t understand the error.

it says you have request limit of 100 every 10 seconds.
make sure to spread those requests or to increase the capacity

Hi all, anyone else having issues with the pages API v3. I tried getting all of the pages from our production portal via the get all webpages api and then using post to upload them to our sandbox portal but its saying its missing the "name" field. Do i need to format the pages or something.
Hey <@U04EV429J6M> what was the api you used to create a page, I cant find it in the legacy docs for the v2 api

Probably a quick answer for someone who is more versed in HubSpot. Is the API only accessible if you are using a paid account? Getting this error when I try to authenticate with PowerAutomate even though I'm the sole admin on the account.
yea, looks like the app is not installable on free accounts
Thanks. Makes sense.

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1688034179477319>
Hi all, I have the same question, but I cannot find any properties (or something else) to get the percentage.
Bumping my above post since I'm still experiencing the problem <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1692890197081529>
Anybody ever encounter error code 1107? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Randomly-started-getting-quot-error-code-1107-quot/m-p/841263#M66904>

it is indeed scary - but HubSpot is generally pretty good at throwing errors if a property update is going to break anything you’ve built using native functionality. So, just be sure to check any custom and/or coded integrations that utilize that property.
seeing a decent amount of 502 Bad Gateway on the API but nothing on <https://status.HubSpot.com/> — anyone else?
yeah same

Yep. Me too <@U037ZPYEGAF>
Smallish Heroku app. During 9:28AM PT to 10:52AM PT there were 6 counts of 502 Bad Gateway from Cloudflare right after some attempt at saving something to the Heroku managed Database

hey guys - having a bit of a hard time finding an answer for this in the API docs, but i need to be able to assign a new task I am creating through the API to a shared task queue, and what type of association that would be. anyone done this before? thanks.

Forgive me if this is not the way to respond, but I've never used the HubSpot Developer Slack before.  I am having the same issue as Phil... exactly.  Started at the same time as well.  11:00am started getting 403 Verifcation failed responses.  When I run it manually on command line via cURL I get that 1007 errors.
The errors spontaneously went away a few minutes ago... after 4 hours of errors.  No changes on my end, so it must have a been a HubSpot issue
why HubSpot? why?
try setting hs_queue_membership_ids property (looks like an array of id strings) where the shared queue id is the id you use
found from `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/tasks>`

<@U0457Q4V08Z> <@U04FYBV18UE>

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/deal_split>

There is a deal_split object it seems, deals are associated to deal_split objects. Try getting deal_split associations to a deal and then retrieve the deal_split by ID via API.

{
            “fromObjectTypeId”: “0-3",
            “toObjectTypeId”: “0-72",
            “name”: “DEAL_TO_DEAL_SPLIT”,
            “cardinality”: “ONE_TO_MANY”,
            “inverseCardinality”: “ONE_TO_ONE”,
            “id”: “313",
            “createdAt”: *null*,
            “updatedAt”: *null*
        },
You can get deal_split properties by checking `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/deal_split>` which seems to have `hs_deal_split_amount`, etc
as well as a `hs_deal_split_percentage` property
search api is less than 100 / 10
• The <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search|Search API> endpoints are rate limited to four requests per second per authentication token.
Last bullet point on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
<@UD53A9UUR> maybe his error message he received is wrong?
I don’t think it’s physically possible to hit the 100/10 second limit without hitting the 4/second limit first

Hello all! I am ultimately trying to subscribe to webhooks for property changes on Line Items. When I try via the UI, I only see a very limited property set. When I try via the api, I get scope errors when using the normal private app bearer token (the private app has access to every possible scope). <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks|This documentation> seems to suggest I need a "developer api key" to access these webhook configuration endpoints. I am able to create a "developer account" and get a "developer api key" via that account, but I don't know how to associate that developer key with my production HubSpot instance such that I can use it to update webhook subscriptions on private apps on my production HubSpot instance.  Can anyone help?

Hello All!
I am facing an invalid date format issue when I create and update contact records using API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").
Please check the screenshot <https://capture.dropbox.com/6b52xWZyWPaI9hdI> and let me correct the format allowed in HubSpot using  API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").
Hmm interesting
Odd that you would be able to get the associated deal split id but not the actual deal split object
Try using a Unix timestamp
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/faq|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/faq>. Right there second question

Hello everyone
I have a query related to this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.

I got the error "MISSING_SCOPES" while using this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.

I checked the Auth token scope with this <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}> and got the below response
{
    "token": "CP6Z-_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVZL7XtKA25hMVIAWgA",
    "user": "<mailto:akshay.dobariya@ajmerainfotech.com|x>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "hub_domain": "<http://app.com|app.com>",
    "scopes": [
        "oauth",
        "files",
        "tickets",
        "files.ui_hidden.read"
    ],
    "hub_id": xxxx,
    "app_id": xxx,
    "expires_in": 1166,
    "user_id": xxxxxxxxxxxx,
    "token_type": "access"
}
